Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Just made `ac_nk=` assetchain param. Allowing any possible combination of equihash N and K parms to be used. 
ASIC resitance  😄

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
turns out its harder than I thaught ... the equihash miner in komodod can only use N values divisible by 8... 
Lucky thr BEAM team has an upgraded miner for values outside this range, almost mnaged to get beam equihash functions to compile into komodod so iut can support basically any number 😃

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So close ... seems need to start again 😦

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I already got all K and N values working, the problem is that you need to define it in the code... so we cant actauly add them all. Mostly did this first because it was easier and, I can learn about how the block hash parts work... before trying to add a new one.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So I will take dukes list of common K and N values and put those in.

Content:
`the problem is that you need to define it in the code.`
Can't you just take out the constants? Or at least define them and set them later in the if?

Content: I tried that and simply no

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The solver makes heavy use of C++ templates ... and it would probably be so slow it would take days fo find a block if I had to re write all that

Content: and well OI dont know how to 😄

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its not much to add common ones, there are already a few in the code., that are unused...  I've just ported some BEAM code over, that allows you to use the default solver with N values that didnt work before like BEAM and AION (?) use

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Before only N values divisible by 8 worked, now they all work, but the Tromp solver does not work with them so daemon mining is very slow.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I tried to amke it a var man, and its not possible 😦

Content:
/*
* Equihash 200,9 (KMD/Zcash)
* Equihash 150,5 (beam)
* Equihash 144,5 (SnowGem)
* Equihash 96,5 (Minex)
* Equihash 210,9 (Aion) */

Content: we have these ones does anyone know of any others I should add?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yeah snowgem is using that one, they got it from someone else. Duke supplied that list.. by removing the unused ones I only had to add one more than was already there

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: trying this 210,9 one atm... like 1GB of ram for a single thread 😆

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its just the default solver .. its liek 100x maybe more slower than tromp. So testing this is pretty time consuming. I'm pretty sure its good though now. Not a lot of code changed in the end to add them all in.
